dtliExcerpt: John Guare's sprawling new play is an ambitious mess that tries to cram too much history, politics and bedroom farce into one evening.
bwwExcerpt: A spectacular folly has just crash-landed at Lincoln Cen ter Theater. Eight years in the making, John Guare's latest play, 'A Free Man of Color,' is an ambitious, awkward, fascinating, lumbering endeavor about the mapping of America's modern physical, social and racial borders. Most of the show, directed by George C. Wolfe, is a maddening slog. But the last 30 minutes are so brilliant that you can't dismiss the whole thing.
